alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 4:50AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northeast Washington, including the following county, Ferry. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Debris flows are also possible in steep terrain, especially near recent burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 443 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rains. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sherman Pass, Ferry, Republic, Twin Lakes, Lake Ellen Campground, Curlew Lake State Park, Inchelium, Malo, Davis Lake, Curlew, Keller, Boyds, Orient, Danville, Toroda and Lauier. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
